items.content:
Sara loved making hot chocolate on cold days. One chilly afternoon, she decided to make some for her family. She gathered all the ingredients: milk, cocoa powder, sugar, and marshmallows.

First, she poured the milk into a pot and heated it on the stove. Then, she added cocoa powder and sugar, stirring carefully until everything was mixed well. The kitchen smelled wonderful as the hot chocolate started to bubble.

Finally, Sara poured the hot chocolate into mugs and topped each one with marshmallows. She called her family to the kitchen. They all enjoyed the warm, sweet drink together. Sara felt happy and proud of her delicious hot chocolate.

- hot chocolate - ช็อกโกแลตร้อน

items.content:
Tom was nervous about his math test. He had studied hard all week, but he still felt a little unsure. His teacher, Ms. Green, handed out the test papers. Tom took a deep breath and started answering the questions.

As he worked through the problems, Tom realized he knew more than he thought. The multiplication and division questions were not as hard as he expected. He remembered all the practice he had done.

When Tom finished, he double-checked his answers. Ms. Green collected the tests and smiled at Tom. "You did great, Tom!" she said. Tom felt relieved and proud. He couldn't wait to tell his parents about his math test.

### Vocabulary List

- math test - การทดสอบคณิตศาสตร์

items.content:
Lily loved spending time in the garden. One bright afternoon, she decided to pick some flowers for her grandma. She knew her grandma loved colorful flowers.

Lily carefully selected the prettiest flowers. She picked roses, daisies, and tulips. Her basket soon filled with beautiful blooms of red, yellow, and pink.

With a big smile, Lily walked to her grandma's house. When her grandma saw the flowers, she was very happy. "Thank you, Lily! These are lovely," she said. Lily felt proud and gave her grandma a big hug. It was a perfect day.

### Vocabulary List

- picking - เก็บ
- flowers - ดอกไม้
- grandma - ย่า/ยาย
- garden - สวน
- bright - สดใส
- afternoon - ตอนบ่าย
- colorful - มีสีสัน
- carefully - อย่างระมัดระวัง

- daisies - ดอกเดซี่

- basket - ตะกร้า

- beautiful - สวยงาม
- blooms - ดอกไม้บาน
- red - สีแดง
- yellow - สีเหลือง
- pink - สีชมพู
- smile - ยิ้ม
- walked - เดิน
- house - บ้าน
- saw - เห็น

- lovely - น่ารัก
- proud - ภูมิใจ
- hug - กอด
- perfect - สมบูรณ์แบบ
- day - วัน

items.content:
Emma and Jack were excited about their science project. They decided to make a volcano. They gathered all the materials: baking soda, vinegar, red food coloring, and a clay volcano model.

First, they shaped the clay into a mountain. Then, they painted it to look like a real volcano. Inside the volcano, they placed the baking soda. Emma added a few drops of red food coloring to the vinegar to make it look like lava.

Finally, it was time for the eruption. Jack poured the vinegar into the volcano. The mixture bubbled up and flowed out, just like real lava. Emma and Jack cheered and took pictures of their amazing science project. They couldn't wait to show it to their class.

### Vocabulary List

- science - วิทยาศาสตร์
- project - โครงการ
- volcano - ภูเขาไฟ
- excited - ตื่นเต้น
- materials - วัสดุ
- baking soda - เบกกิ้งโซดา
- vinegar - น้ำส้มสายชู
- red - สีแดง
- food coloring - สีผสมอาหาร
- clay - ดินเหนียว
- model - แบบจำลอง
- shaped - ปั้น
- mountain - ภูเขา
- painted - ทาสี
- real - จริง
- placed - วาง
- inside - ข้างใน
- added - เพิ่ม
- drops - หยด
- look like - ดูเหมือน
- lava - ลาวา
- finally - ในที่สุด
- eruption - การระเบิด
- mixture - ส่วนผสม
- bubbled up - ฟูขึ้น
- flowed out - ไหลออกมา
- cheered - เชียร์
- pictures - รูปภาพ
- amazing - น่าทึ่ง
- class - ชั้นเรียน

items.content:
Tim loved fishing with his dad. One sunny morning, they went to the lake with their fishing poles and bait. The water was calm, and the birds were singing.

Tim cast his line into the water and waited patiently. Suddenly, he felt a strong tug. "I got something!" he shouted. His dad came over to help him reel in the fish. It was a big one!

They pulled the fish out of the water. Tim's eyes widened with excitement. It was the biggest fish he had ever caught. They took a picture together with the fish, smiling proudly. Tim knew this would be a fishing trip he would always remember.

### Vocabulary List 

- fishing - การตกปลา
- dad - พ่อ
- sunny - แดดออก

- lake - ทะเลสาบ

- reel in - ม้วนเข้า
- fish - ปลา

- eyes - ตา

- remember - จำได้

items.title: The Big Catch

items.content:
Klaus ist eine kleine, graue Ratte. Er lebt in einem Buchladen. Der Buchladen gehört Frau Müller. Sie ist sehr nett und liebt Bücher. Klaus auch. Er liebt Bücher über alles.

Jeden Morgen, wenn Frau Müller den Laden öffnet, wacht Klaus auf. Er putzt sich und macht sich bereit für den Tag. Klaus hat eine wichtige Aufgabe. Er hilft jungen Kindern, lesen zu lernen.

Die Kinder lieben Klaus. Er ist sehr freundlich und hat immer ein Lächeln auf dem Gesicht. Wenn ein Kind in den Laden kommt, zeigt Klaus ihm die schönsten Bücher. Er kennt alle Geschichten und weiß genau, welches Buch zu welchem Kind passt.

Eines Tages kommt ein Junge namens Tim in den Buchladen. Tim ist ein bisschen schüchtern und hat Schwierigkeiten beim Lesen. Klaus merkt das sofort. Er läuft zu Tim und stupst ihn sanft an.

"Hallo Tim," sagt Klaus freundlich. "Möchtest du ein tolles Buch lesen?"

Tim schaut überrascht, aber er nickt. Klaus führt ihn zu einem Regal mit einfachen Büchern. Er zieht ein Buch heraus und gibt es Tim. Es heißt "Der kleine Prinz".

"Das ist ein wunderbares Buch," sagt Klaus. "Lass uns zusammen lesen."

Tim setzt sich hin und beginnt zu lesen. Klaus sitzt neben ihm und hilft, wenn Tim ein schwieriges Wort nicht kennt. Mit der Zeit wird Tim besser und besser im Lesen. Er ist glücklich und stolz auf sich.

Jeden Tag kommt Tim in den Buchladen und liest mit Klaus. Die beiden werden gute Freunde. Frau Müller ist auch sehr froh. Sie sieht, wie glücklich die Kinder sind, wenn sie mit Klaus lesen.

Klaus, die kleine, graue Ratte, ist ein echter Held im Buchladen. Er hilft den Kindern nicht nur beim Lesen, sondern schenkt ihnen auch Freude und Selbstvertrauen.

- die Ratte (the rat)
- der Buchladen (the bookstore)
- der Laden (the shop)
- die Aufgabe (the task)
- die Kinder (the children)
- freundlich (friendly)
- das Gesicht (the face)
- das Buch (the book)
- die Geschichte (the story)
- das Regal (the shelf)
- schwierig (difficult)
- stolz (proud)
- der Held (the hero)
- die Freude (the joy)
- das Selbstvertrauen (the confidence)
- klein (small)
- grau (gray)
- lesen (to read)
- lernen (to learn)
- helfen (to help)
- zeigen (to show)
- lächeln (to smile)
- nett (kind)
- bereit (ready)
- wichtig (important)
- Schwierigkeiten (difficulties)
- überraschen (surprise)
- zusammen (together)
- besser (better)
- glücklich (happy)
- Freunde (friends)

items.title: Klaus, die Ratte im Buchladen

items.content:
I was sitting on the windowsill, enjoying the warm sunlight. My name is Whiskers, and I am a curious cat. My favorite thing is to watch the world outside the window. Birds fly by, and sometimes I see squirrels running around. But today, something different happened.

A beautiful butterfly was fluttering outside. It had bright orange and black wings. I watched it dance in the air, going from flower to flower. Suddenly, a gust of wind blew the butterfly towards our house. To my surprise, it flew right in through the open window!

The butterfly was now inside our house, flying around the living room. I jumped down from the windowsill and followed it with my eyes. It landed on the couch, then on the table, and finally, it flew up to the ceiling.

I wanted to catch it, but I didn't want to hurt it. I just wanted to play. I chased it gently, jumping from one piece of furniture to another. The butterfly was fast and clever. It dodged my paws and flew to the kitchen.

In the kitchen, the butterfly landed on a plant. I sat quietly, watching it. My tail twitched with excitement. The butterfly stayed still for a moment, and I could see its delicate wings up close. It was so beautiful!

Just then, my human came into the room. She saw the butterfly and smiled. "Oh, a butterfly!" she said. She opened the kitchen window wide. Slowly, the butterfly flew out through the window and back into the garden.

I sat by the window, watching it disappear into the flowers. I was a little sad to see it go. Maybe one day, it will come back to visit me. Until then, I will keep watching the world outside, waiting for the next adventure.

- windowsill - ขอบหน้าต่าง
- sunlight - แสงแดด
- world - โลก

- adventure - การผจญภัย

items.title: The Butterfly in the House

items.content:
Es war ein ruhiger Abend in der kleinen Stadt. Die Menschen gingen spazieren, Kinder spielten im Park, und die Sonne ging langsam unter. Aber dann passierte etwas Seltsames. Am Horizont erschien eine dunkle Wolke.

Lisa und Tom waren gerade auf dem Weg nach Hause, als sie die Wolke sahen. „Was ist das?“ fragte Lisa. „Ich weiß es nicht“, antwortete Tom. „Lass uns nachsehen.“

Als sie näher kamen, sahen sie, dass es keine Wolke war. Es waren viele Menschen, die langsam auf die Stadt zukamen. Ihre Haut war grau und ihre Augen leuchteten rot. „Das sind Zombies!“ schrie Tom. „Wir müssen die Stadt warnen!“

Lisa und Tom rannten so schnell sie konnten zum Rathaus. Sie klopften an die Tür und riefen: „Zombies kommen! Wir müssen etwas tun!“ Der Bürgermeister hörte sie und öffnete die Tür. „Zombies?“ fragte er erstaunt. „Ja, sie sind schon fast hier!“ rief Lisa.

Der Bürgermeister zögerte nicht. Er rief sofort die Polizei und die Feuerwehr. „Alle in die Häuser! Schließt die Türen und Fenster!“ rief er durch das Megafon. Die Menschen rannten in ihre Häuser und verriegelten alles.

Die Zombies kamen immer näher. Sie versuchten, in die Häuser einzudringen, aber die Türen waren fest verschlossen. Die Polizei und die Feuerwehr kämpften tapfer gegen die Zombies. Sie verwendeten Wasser und laute Sirenen, um die Zombies zu vertreiben.

Nach vielen Stunden harter Arbeit gelang es ihnen endlich, die Zombies zurückzudrängen. Die Sonne ging wieder auf, und die Menschen kamen vorsichtig aus ihren Häusern. Die Stadt war gerettet.

Lisa und Tom waren Helden. „Wir haben es geschafft!“ sagte Tom. „Ja, aber wir müssen immer wachsam sein,“ antwortete Lisa. „Die Zombies könnten zurückkommen.“

### Vocabulary

- Abend (evening)
- Stadt (town)
- Menschen (people)
- Spaziergang (walk)
- Kinder (children)
- Park (park)
- Sonne (sun)
- Wolke (cloud)
- Horizont (horizon)
- Lisa und Tom (Lisa and Tom)
- Weg (way)
- Haut (skin)
- Augen (eyes)
- Zombies (zombies)
- Rathaus (town hall)
- Tür (door)
- Bürgermeister (mayor)
- Polizei (police)
- Feuerwehr (fire department)
- Häuser (houses)
- Fenster (windows)
- Sirenen (sirens)
- Helden (heroes)
- Nacht (night)
- Verteidigen (defend)
- Dringen (to penetrate)
- Vertreiben (to drive away)
- Zurückkommen (to come back)

items.title: Die Zombie-Invasion

items.content:
Jake loved to read books, especially at night. One night, after everyone had gone to bed, Jake took out his favorite book and a small flashlight. He climbed under his cozy blanket and turned on the light.

The flashlight made a small, bright circle on the page. Jake read about brave knights and magical lands. The more he read, the more excited he became. He could imagine every scene in his mind.

Even though it was late, Jake didn’t feel tired. He loved the quiet time to himself, lost in his book. Finally, after finishing another chapter, Jake let out a satisfied sigh, turned off the flashlight, and drifted off to sleep, dreaming of adventures.

### Vocabulary List for Thai Speakers Learning English

- books - หนังสือ
- night - กลางคืน

Jake loved to read books, especially at night.
Jake loved to read books, especially at night.
One night, after everyone had gone to bed, Jake took out his favorite book and a small flashlight.
One night, after everyone had gone to bed, Jake took out his favorite book and a small flashlight.
He climbed under his cozy blanket and turned on the light.
He climbed under his cozy blanket and turned on the light.
The flashlight made a small, bright circle on the page.
The flashlight made a small, bright circle on the page.
Jake read about brave knights and magical lands.
Jake read about brave knights and magical lands.
The more he read, the more excited he became.
The more he read, the more excited he became.
He could imagine every scene in his mind.
He could imagine every scene in his mind.
Even though it was late, Jake didn’t feel tired.
Even though it was late, Jake didn’t feel tired.
He loved the quiet time to himself, lost in his book.
He loved the quiet time to himself, lost in his book.
Finally, after finishing another chapter, Jake let out a satisfied sigh, turned off the flashlight, and drifted off to sleep, dreaming of adventures.

items.content:
Lucy was excited when she heard the news. Her cat, Bella, had given birth to three tiny kittens. Lucy rushed to the basket where Bella and the kittens were resting. The kittens were so small and cute, with soft fur and tiny paws.

Lucy gently picked up one kitten. It had bright blue eyes and a fluffy tail. The other two kittens were cuddled close to Bella, purring softly. Lucy could hardly wait to show them to her friends.

That afternoon, Lucy's friends came over to see the new kittens. They took turns holding the kittens and playing with them. Everyone agreed that the kittens were the cutest they had ever seen. Lucy felt so happy and proud to have such adorable new pets.

items.content:
Heute habe ich den ganzen Tag mit meinen Lieblingsbüchern verbracht. Ich liebe es, in spannende Geschichten einzutauchen. Am Morgen habe ich mir eine gemütliche Ecke mit vielen Kissen und einer Decke eingerichtet. Dort habe ich angefangen zu lesen.

Mein erstes Buch handelte von einem mutigen Ritter, der gegen Drachen kämpfte. Die Geschichte war so aufregend, dass ich gar nicht aufhören konnte zu lesen. Nach einer Weile machte ich eine Pause und trank eine Tasse heißen Kakao. Dann suchte ich mir ein neues Buch aus.

Das zweite Buch war eine lustige Geschichte über eine Gruppe von Freunden, die ein Baumhaus bauen. Ich musste oft lachen, weil die Abenteuer so komisch waren. Am Abend, als die Sonne unterging, hatte ich schon zwei Bücher gelesen und fühlte mich glücklich und zufrieden. Lesen ist wirklich das Beste.

### Vokabelliste

- Bücher - Books
- Lieblingsbücher - Favorite books
- spannende Geschichten - Exciting stories
- gemütliche Ecke - Cozy corner
- Kissen - Pillows
- Decke - Blanket

- mutiger Ritter - Brave knight
- Drachen - Dragons
- aufregend - Exciting
- Pause machen - Take a break
- heißen Kakao - Hot cocoa
- lustige Geschichte - Funny story
- Freunde - Friends
- Baumhaus - Treehouse
- Abenteuer - Adventures
- lachen - Laugh
- zufrieden - Content
- das Beste - The best

items.title: Ein Tag mit Büchern

items.content:
Heute hat unsere Hündin vier kleine Welpen bekommen. Sie sind so süß und kuschelig. Ich war sehr aufgeregt, als ich sie zum ersten Mal gesehen habe. Die Welpen haben weiches Fell und kleine, runde Bäuche.

Ich habe mich neben das Körbchen gesetzt und zugeschaut, wie die Welpen herumkrabbeln. Sie haben versucht, auf ihren kleinen Beinen zu stehen und sind oft umgefallen. Es war sehr lustig und niedlich. Mama sagte, wir dürfen den Welpen Namen geben. Ich habe mir viele Gedanken gemacht, wie sie heißen könnten.

Am Abend habe ich den Welpen noch einmal Gute Nacht gesagt und sie sanft gestreichelt. Ich freue mich schon darauf, mit ihnen zu spielen und ihnen beim Wachsen zuzusehen. Es war ein besonderer Tag, und ich bin so glücklich über unsere neuen Familienmitglieder.

### Vokabelliste

- Welpen - Puppies
- Hündin - Dog (female)
- süß - Cute
- kuschelig - Cuddly
- aufgeregt - Excited
- Fell - Fur
- runde Bäuche - Round bellies
- Körbchen - Basket
- krabbeln - Crawl
- Beine - Legs
- umfallen - Fall over
- niedlich - Adorable
- Namen geben - Name (give a name)
- Gedanken machen - Think about
- Gute Nacht sagen - Say good night
- streicheln - Pet
- spielen - Play
- wachsen - Grow
- besonderer Tag - Special day
- Familienmitglieder - Family members

items.content:
Don loved to draw pictures. Every day after school, he would sit at his desk with his pencils and paper. His favorite things to draw were frogs and dogs.

One day, Don drew a big, green frog. It had spots and long legs. Then, he drew a happy dog with floppy ears and a wagging tail. Don smiled at his drawings and felt proud.

He showed his drawings to his mom and dad. They said, "Great job, Don!" Don felt happy and kept drawing more pictures. He knew he wanted to be an artist one day.

items.title: Don's Drawing Day

items.content:
One fine morning in the fairy garden, Sparkle was watering the flowers when she heard a soft cry for help. She flew towards the sound and found a tiny, wilted flower hidden under a large leaf. The flower looked sad and weak.

Sparkle gently picked up the flower and carried it to Queen Lily. "Queen Lily, this flower needs help. What can we do?" Sparkle asked. Queen Lily examined the flower and said, "This is a magic flower. It blooms once every hundred years and has special powers. We must help it regain its strength."

Queen Lily gave Sparkle a special potion made from the garden’s rarest herbs. She instructed Sparkle to sprinkle the potion on the flower and to sing a special song to it every day. Sparkle was determined to save the magic flower.

Every day, Sparkle took care of the flower. She sprinkled the potion on its leaves and petals and sang the special song. Slowly, the flower began to revive. Its petals started to open, and it began to glow with a soft, magical light.

One night, as Sparkle was singing to the flower, it started to speak. "Thank you, Sparkle. Your kindness and care have saved me. I am the Magic Flower, and I have a gift for you." The flower’s light grew brighter, and it transformed into a beautiful fairy with sparkling wings.

The Magic Flower fairy thanked Sparkle again and handed her a small, glowing seed. "Plant this seed in the garden, and it will bring everlasting beauty and joy to all who visit," the fairy said. Sparkle was overjoyed and promised to take good care of the seed.

The next morning, Sparkle planted the glowing seed in the middle of the garden. As she watered it and sang the special song, the seed quickly sprouted and grew into a magnificent tree with sparkling flowers. The tree’s blossoms filled the garden with a magical fragrance, and the garden became more beautiful than ever.

The fairies and animals were delighted with the new tree. It brought happiness and joy to everyone who visited the garden. Sparkle was praised for her kindness and dedication, and she felt proud of her achievement.

The Magic Flower fairy often visited the garden, bringing more magic and joy with her. Sparkle continued to care for the garden, always ready to help any creature in need. The fairy garden flourished, filled with love, magic, and happiness.

And so, Sparkle and the fairies lived happily ever after, their garden a paradise of beauty and wonder.

items.title: Sparkle and the Magic Flower

items.content:
In the fairy garden, Sparkle was known as the fairy who saved a bird. She loved exploring the forest and often found new and exciting things. One sunny morning, Sparkle decided to fly deeper into the forest than ever before.

As she flew, Sparkle saw many beautiful sights. There were tall trees, colorful flowers, and sparkling streams. Suddenly, she noticed something shiny on the ground. Sparkle landed and discovered a small, golden key hidden under some leaves.

Curious, Sparkle picked up the key and looked around. She wondered what the key could open. She flew back to the fairy garden and showed the key to Queen Lily. The queen smiled and said, "This key must open a hidden treasure. It is said that a long time ago, a treasure was hidden in the forest by an ancient fairy."

Sparkle was excited and asked if she could search for the treasure. Queen Lily agreed and gave Sparkle a map that showed the way to the hidden treasure. Sparkle thanked the queen and set off on her adventure.

Following the map, Sparkle flew over hills and through valleys. She crossed streams and walked through flower fields. After a long journey, Sparkle reached a large, old tree with a small lock on its trunk. Sparkle knew this was the place.

She took out the golden key and carefully inserted it into the lock. The lock clicked open, and a hidden door in the tree revealed a small, wooden chest. Sparkle opened the chest and found it filled with glittering jewels, gold coins, and beautiful gems.

Sparkle was amazed by the treasure. She took some of the jewels and coins back to the fairy garden to show Queen Lily. The queen was very pleased and praised Sparkle for her bravery and determination.

The treasure was used to make the fairy garden even more beautiful. Sparkle and the other fairies used the jewels to decorate the flowers and trees. The garden sparkled like never before, and the fairies were happier than ever.

Sparkle became a hero once again, known for finding the lost treasure. She continued to explore and have adventures, always curious and brave. The fairy garden remained a magical and wonderful place, full of beauty and happiness.

And so, Sparkle and the fairies lived happily ever after, their garden shining brightly with the newfound treasure.

#### Vocabulary

- Fairy (นางฟ้า)
- Garden (สวน)
- Explore (สำรวจ)
- Forest (ป่า)
- Sunny (มีแดด)
- Morning (ตอนเช้า)

- Hero (วีรบุรุษ)

items.title: Sparkle and the Lost Treasure

items.content:
Once upon a time, in a beautiful forest, there was a magical garden. This garden was the home of many fairies. The fairies were tiny, with wings that sparkled like the morning dew. They loved to take care of the flowers and plants in the garden.

In the middle of the garden, there was a big, old tree. This tree was very special because it had a door at its base. The door was so small that only the fairies could enter. Inside the tree, there was a cozy little house where the fairy queen lived. Her name was Lily, and she was kind and wise.

Every morning, the fairies would gather around the tree to receive their tasks from Queen Lily. They would water the flowers, paint the leaves with bright colors, and sing songs to make the plants grow. The garden was always full of colors and sweet fragrances because of the fairies’ hard work.

One day, a young fairy named Sparkle found a wounded bird near the garden. She felt sad and wanted to help. Sparkle carefully carried the bird to Queen Lily. The queen told Sparkle to gather some magical herbs from the garden. Sparkle flew quickly and brought back the herbs.

Queen Lily mixed the herbs and made a potion. She sprinkled the potion on the bird, and soon the bird started to heal. The bird chirped happily and flew around Sparkle, thanking her. Sparkle was very happy and proud of herself.

From that day on, Sparkle became known as the fairy who saved the bird. The fairies continued to take care of their garden, and it became even more beautiful. The birds, butterflies, and animals loved visiting the fairy garden. It was a place full of magic, love, and happiness.

And so, the fairies and their garden lived happily ever after.

#### Vocabulary

- Fairy (นางฟ้า)
- Garden (สวน)
- Forest (ป่า)
- Magical (มีมนต์ขลัง)
- Tiny (เล็ก)

items.title: The Fairy Garden

items.content:
My time in America was coming to an end. It had been an incredible journey full of learning, growth, and unforgettable experiences. As I packed my suitcase, I thought about all the wonderful memories I had made and the friendships I had formed.

On my last day, Emily and her family organized a farewell party for me. It was a bittersweet moment. I was excited to go back to Thailand and see my family, but I was also sad to leave my new friends. The party was filled with laughter, good food, and heartfelt goodbyes.

Emily gave me a scrapbook filled with photos and notes from all my friends and teachers. It was a beautiful gift, and I knew I would cherish it forever. I thanked everyone for making my stay in America so special.

At the airport, we shared one last hug. Emily said, “Ploy, you will always have a home here in America. We will miss you, but we know you will do great things back in Thailand.”

As I boarded the plane, I felt a mix of emotions. I was sad to leave, but I was also proud of myself for everything I had accomplished. This experience had taught me so much about the world and about myself. I knew I had grown stronger and more confident.

When I landed in Thailand, my family was there to greet me with open arms. It felt wonderful to be home. I shared my stories and experiences with them, and they were proud of how much I had grown.

Looking back, I realized that my time in America was just the beginning of many more adventures to come. I had learned to embrace new challenges, appreciate different cultures, and cherish the connections I made. I knew that no matter where life took me, I would carry these lessons with me.

And so, with a heart full of gratitude and memories, I looked forward to the future and the endless possibilities it held.

### Vocabulary List

- unforgettable (ที่ลืมไม่ลง)
- memories (ความทรงจำ)
- friendships (มิตรภาพ)
- bittersweet (มีทั้งสุขและเศร้า)
- heartfelt (จริงใจ)
- scrapbook (สมุดภาพและบันทึก)
- cherish (ทะนุถนอม)
- accomplish (ประสบความสำเร็จ)
- greet (ทักทาย)
- embrace (ยอมรับ)
- challenges (ความท้าทาย)
- appreciate (ชื่นชม)
- connections (ความสัมพันธ์)
- gratitude (ความกตัญญู)
- possibilities (ความเป็นไปได้)

items.title: Chapter 10: A New Beginning

items.content:
As my time in America continued, I sometimes felt homesick. I missed my family, friends, and the familiar sights and sounds of BangKhla. To help me feel closer to home, Emily and her family decided to have a special Thai dinner night.

We planned the dinner together. I wrote down some of my favorite Thai recipes and went with Emily's mom to the grocery store to find the ingredients. It was exciting to see familiar foods in the store, and I felt happy knowing I could share a piece of my culture with my host family.

That evening, we cooked together in the kitchen. I taught them how to make dishes like Pad Thai, Tom Yum soup, and mango sticky rice. It was fun to explain the ingredients and cooking techniques. Everyone was very enthusiastic and eager to learn.

When the food was ready, we sat down to eat. The flavors and aromas reminded me of home, and it made me feel warm inside. Emily's family loved the food and complimented me on my cooking. They said it was a wonderful way to learn about my culture and experience something new.

During dinner, I shared stories about Thailand and my family. I told them about our traditions, festivals, and everyday life. It was nice to talk about my home and feel connected to it even though I was far away.

After dinner, we watched a Thai movie with English subtitles. Emily and her family enjoyed the movie and asked me questions about Thai language and culture. It was a perfect end to a wonderful evening.

Having a taste of home helped me feel more balanced and happy. I realized that no matter where I was, I could always find ways to connect with my roots and share my culture with others.

### Vocabulary List

- homesick (คิดถึงบ้าน)
- familiar (คุ้นเคย)
- ingredients (ส่วนผสม)
- recipes (สูตรอาหาร)
- Pad Thai (ผัดไทย)
- Tom Yum soup (ต้มยำ)
- mango sticky rice (ข้าวเหนียวมะม่วง)
- techniques (เทคนิค)
- enthusiastic (กระตือรือร้น)
- aromas (กลิ่นหอม)
- traditions (ประเพณี)
- festivals (เทศกาล)
- subtitles (คำบรรยายใต้ภาพ)
- balance (ความสมดุล)

items.title: Chapter 9: A Taste of Home

items.content:
As the weeks went by, I started to adjust more to my new school life in America. Every day, I learned something new. My English was improving, and I felt more confident in my classes. The teachers were very supportive and always ready to help me if I didn't understand something.

One of my favorite subjects was art. I loved drawing and painting, and the art teacher, Ms. Wilson, was very encouraging. She told me that art was a great way to express myself and share my culture with others. I enjoyed working on my art projects and even participated in an art show at the school. My painting of a Thai temple received many compliments, and I felt proud to represent my heritage.

I also joined the school's soccer team. I had played soccer in Thailand, so it was nice to continue playing here. The team was very welcoming, and it was a fun way to make new friends and stay active. We practiced after school and had games on the weekends. It felt good to be part of a team and work together.

During lunch, I often sat with Emily and her friends. They made sure I never felt alone. We talked about our classes, shared funny stories, and sometimes helped each other with homework. I was grateful to have such kind and supportive friends.

Outside of school, I spent time exploring the town with Emily. We went to the library, visited local shops, and even tried ice skating for the first time. It was a bit challenging at first, but Emily and I laughed a lot as we tried to keep our balance.

### Vocabulary List

- adjust (ปรับตัว)
- supportive (สนับสนุน)
- art (ศิลปะ)
- express (แสดงออก)
- represent (เป็นตัวแทน)
- heritage (มรดก)
- soccer team (ทีมฟุตบอล)
- active (กระฉับกระเฉง)
- participate (เข้าร่วม)
- compliments (คำชม)
- grateful (ขอบคุณ)
- explore (สำรวจ)
- ice skating (การเล่นสเก็ตน้ำแข็ง)
- balance (ความสมดุล)

items.title: Chapter 8: Adjusting to School Life

items.content:
One of the most exciting experiences I had in America was celebrating Thanksgiving with Emily's family. I had heard about this holiday before but never experienced it. Emily explained that it was a time for family and friends to come together, give thanks, and enjoy a big meal.

In the days leading up to Thanksgiving, the whole family was busy preparing. Emily's mom spent a lot of time in the kitchen, cooking delicious food. I helped her bake pies and learned how to make a traditional Thanksgiving turkey. The house smelled wonderful with all the food cooking.

On Thanksgiving Day, relatives and friends came over to celebrate. The house was full of laughter and conversation. Everyone was very kind and welcomed me warmly. We played games, watched a parade on TV, and shared stories.

When it was time for dinner, the table was filled with a feast. There was turkey, stuffing, mashed potatoes, cranberry sauce, and many other dishes. It was amazing to see so much food! Before we ate, everyone took turns saying what they were thankful for. When it was my turn, I said, “I am thankful for my new friends and this wonderful experience in America.”

After dinner, we had dessert. The pies we baked were a big hit. Everyone loved them, and I felt proud to have helped. We spent the rest of the evening talking and enjoying each other's company. It was a special day, and I felt very happy and grateful.

Celebrating Thanksgiving made me feel even more connected to Emily's family and to American culture. I realized that even though I was far from home, I had found a second family who cared about me.

### Vocabulary List

- celebrating (การเฉลิมฉลอง)
- Thanksgiving (วันขอบคุณพระเจ้า)
- holiday (วันหยุด)
- relatives (ญาติ)
- conversation (การสนทนา)
- parade (ขบวนพาเหรด)
- feast (งานเลี้ยง)
- stuffing (ไส้)
- mashed potatoes (มันฝรั่งบด)
- cranberry sauce (ซอสแครนเบอร์รี่)
- thankful (ขอบคุณ)
- dessert (ของหวาน)
- second family (ครอบครัวที่สอง)

items.title: Chapter 7: Celebrating Thanksgiving

items.content:
One Saturday, Emily and her family decided to take me on a trip to explore the city. I was excited to see more of America and learn about its culture. We left early in the morning and drove for about an hour before reaching the city.

The city was big and bustling with activity. There were tall buildings, busy streets, and so many people. It was very different from BangKhla. Our first stop was a famous museum. Inside, I saw many interesting exhibits about American history and culture. Emily’s parents explained some of the exhibits to me, and I learned a lot.

After the museum, we went to a park in the middle of the city. It was beautiful with green grass, tall trees, and a large fountain. We had a picnic there and enjoyed the sunny weather. Emily and I played some games and took lots of pictures.

In the afternoon, we visited a shopping mall. It was huge and had many stores. I bought some souvenirs for my family and friends back in Thailand. Emily helped me pick out some nice clothes and a few books in English to practice reading.

Our last stop was a Thai restaurant that Sarah had told us about. I was excited to try the food and see if it was like the food back home. The restaurant was cozy, and the staff were very friendly. I ordered Pad Thai, and it tasted just like my mom's cooking. It made me feel a bit homesick, but also happy to have a taste of home.

By the end of the day, I was tired but happy. It was a wonderful experience to explore the city and learn more about American culture. I was grateful to Emily and her family for taking me on this adventure.

### Vocabulary List

- explore (สำรวจ)
- bustling (คึกคัก)
- exhibits (นิทรรศการ)
- history (ประวัติศาสตร์)
- fountain (น้ำพุ)
- picnic (ปิกนิก)
- souvenirs (ของที่ระลึก)
- practice (ฝึกฝน)
- cozy (อบอุ่น)
- homesick (คิดถึงบ้าน)
- adventure (การผจญภัย)

items.title: Chapter 6: Exploring the City

items.content:
The days after my first day of school were filled with new experiences. I slowly got used to the routine and started feeling more comfortable. One of the best parts was making new friends.

Emily introduced me to her group of friends, and they were all very welcoming. They invited me to sit with them during lunch and join their study group. One of Emily's friends, Sarah, was particularly friendly. She loved learning about Thailand and often asked me questions about my culture and traditions.

One day, Sarah invited me to her house for a small get-together. I was excited and a little nervous. At her house, I met her family, who were very kind. They were curious about Thailand and asked me to teach them some Thai words. It was fun sharing my language and culture with them.

We played games, listened to music, and talked about our favorite movies and books. I felt like I was starting to fit in and make real connections. Sarah even told me about a Thai restaurant in the city, and we made plans to go there together one weekend.

At school, I joined a club called the International Club. It was a group of students from different countries who met once a week to share their cultures and experiences. I made friends from many different places and learned a lot about their countries. It was comforting to meet other students who were also far from home.

As the weeks went by, I felt more and more at home in America. I was grateful for my new friends and the opportunities to learn and grow. I knew that this experience was making me a stronger and more confident person.

### Vocabulary List

- routine (กิจวัตรประจำวัน)
- welcoming (ยินดีต้อนรับ)
- study group (กลุ่มศึกษา)
- traditions (ประเพณี)
- get-together (การพบปะสังสรรค์)
- connections (การเชื่อมต่อ)
- restaurant (ร้านอาหาร)
- International Club (ชมรมนานาชาติ)
- experiences (ประสบการณ์)
- opportunities (โอกาส)
- grateful (ขอบคุณ)
- confident (มั่นใจ)

items.title: Chapter 5: Making Friends

items.content:
The first day of school in America was a big day for me. I woke up early, feeling both excited and nervous. Emily helped me pick out my clothes and gave me some advice about what to expect. She said, “Don’t worry, Ploy. Everyone will be curious about you and want to be your friend.”

When we arrived at school, I saw many students chatting and laughing. The school was much larger than my school in BangKhla. I followed Emily to the office, where we got my schedule and a map of the school. Then, Emily took me to my first class: English.

The teacher, Mrs. Brown, was very welcoming. She introduced me to the class and asked me to tell a little bit about myself. I was nervous, but I took a deep breath and said, “Hello, my name is Ploy. I am from Thailand. I am excited to be here and learn with you.”

Everyone smiled and clapped. After that, I felt more relaxed. The students were friendly and asked me many questions about Thailand. It was nice to talk about my home and share my culture with them.

The rest of the day went by quickly. I went to different classes, met new teachers, and made some friends. Some of the subjects were hard, but the teachers were patient and explained things clearly. Emily checked on me throughout the day, making sure I was okay and helping me find my classes.

By the end of the day, I was tired but happy. My first day of school in America was a success. I knew that I would learn a lot and make many new friends during my time here.

### Vocabulary List

- advice (คำแนะนำ)
- expect (คาดหวัง)
- curious (อยากรู้อยากเห็น)
- chatting (พูดคุย)
- larger (ใหญ่กว่า)
- schedule (ตารางเวลา)
- map (แผนที่)
- welcoming (ต้อนรับ)
- introduced (แนะนำ)
- nervous (ประหม่า)
- relaxed (ผ่อนคลาย)
- culture (วัฒนธรรม)
- subjects (วิชา)
- success (ความสำเร็จ)

items.title: Chapter 4: First Day of School

items.content:
The flight to America was long and tiring. I was excited, but also a little nervous. When the plane finally landed, I couldn't believe I was really in America. Everything looked so different from BangKhla.

At the airport, I met my host family. They were holding a sign with my name on it. They welcomed me with big smiles and warm hugs. My host parents were very kind, and they had a daughter about my age. Her name was Emily. She was very friendly and made me feel at home right away.

On the drive to their house, I looked out the window and saw tall buildings, busy streets, and many cars. It was very different from the quiet town where I grew up. My host family lived in a nice neighborhood with lots of trees and parks. Their house was big and beautiful. They showed me my room, which was cozy and comfortable.

Over the next few days, I got to know my host family better. They took me to see the local sights and introduced me to their friends. Emily helped me get ready for school. She showed me around the school and helped me understand my schedule. The school was much bigger than my school in Thailand, and there were so many students.

Everyone was very friendly, but sometimes it was hard to understand everything because people spoke so quickly. I practiced my English every day and tried to learn new words. My teachers were helpful and patient, and they made sure I understood my lessons.

Even though everything was new and different, I started to feel more comfortable. I knew that I was going to have a great time in America, and I was excited to learn and experience new things.

### Vocabulary List

- arrival (การมาถึง)
- flight (เที่ยวบิน)
- host family (ครอบครัวที่อุปการะ)
- sign (ป้าย)
- friendly (เป็นมิตร)
- neighborhood (ย่านที่พักอาศัย)
- cozy (อบอุ่น)
- comfortable (สะดวกสบาย)
- local sights (สถานที่ท่องเที่ยวในท้องถิ่น)
- schedule (ตารางเวลา)
- quickly (อย่างรวดเร็ว)
- patient (อดทน)
- lessons (บทเรียน)

items.title: Chapter 3: Arrival in America

items.content:
The days went by quickly as I prepared for my journey to America. There was so much to do! My mom helped me pack my suitcase. We carefully chose clothes for different seasons because I heard that the weather in America can be very different from Thailand.

I also had to visit the embassy in Bangkok to get my visa. It was a long trip, but it was worth it. The people at the embassy were very nice and helped me with all the paperwork. When I finally got my visa, I felt a step closer to my dream.

Back home, my friends threw me a small farewell party. We ate delicious food and took many pictures. They gave me small gifts to remind me of home. One of my friends gave me a journal to write about my adventures in America. I promised to write often and share my experiences with them.

Every night, I practiced English with my family. We watched English movies with Thai subtitles and spoke English during dinner. My little brother even tried to learn some English words with me. It was fun and helpful.

As my departure day approached, I felt a mix of emotions. I was excited to see new places and meet new people, but I was also sad to leave my family and friends. They assured me that they would always be there for me, no matter how far I went.

Finally, the big day arrived. My parents drove me to the airport. With my suitcase packed and my heart full of hope, I said goodbye to my home. I was ready for my new adventure in America.

### Vocabulary List

- prepare (เตรียม)
- journey (การเดินทาง)
- suitcase (กระเป๋าเดินทาง)
- seasons (ฤดูกาล)
- embassy (สถานทูต)
- visa (วีซ่า)
- paperwork (เอกสาร)
- farewell (อำลา)
- delicious (อร่อย)
- gifts (ของขวัญ)
- journal (สมุดบันทึก)
- subtitles (คำบรรยาย)
- emotions (ความรู้สึก)
- airport (สนามบิน)
- hope (ความหวัง)

items.title: Chapter 2: Preparing for the Journey

items.content:
My name is Ploy, and I live in a small town in Thailand. It's a peaceful place with beautiful temples and a river that flows through the heart of our town. One sunny morning, I received the most exciting news of my life: I was selected to be an exchange student in America!

I couldn't believe it at first. I read the letter over and over again. My parents were so proud and happy for me. They hugged me and said, "Ploy, this is a great opportunity for you to learn and experience new things."

I felt a mix of excitement and nervousness. America seemed so far away and different from my small town. I wondered what it would be like to live there, to go to school there, and to make new friends. But I was ready for the adventure. I knew it would be a chance to grow and to see the world.

The next few weeks were busy. I had to prepare many things for my trip. I needed to improve my English, get my documents ready, and learn about American culture. My friends and family supported me every step of the way. They told me stories, shared tips, and helped me practice speaking English.

As the day of my departure approached, I felt more confident. I knew that this experience would change my life forever. I was ready to say goodbye to my town and hello to America.

### Vocabulary List

- exchange student (นักเรียนแลกเปลี่ยน)
- peaceful (เงียบสงบ)
- exciting (น่าตื่นเต้น)
- opportunity (โอกาส)
- experience (ประสบการณ์)
- nervousness (ความกังวล)
- different (แตกต่าง)
- adventure (การผจญภัย)
- grow (เติบโต)
- documents (เอกสาร)
- culture (วัฒนธรรม)
- confident (มั่นใจ)
- departure (การเดินทางออก)
- support (สนับสนุน)

items.title: Chapter 1: The Big News

items.content:
Un jour, mon père m'a proposé d'aller chasser les lapins. J'étais très excité car je n'avais jamais chassé auparavant. Nous avons pris nos fusils et Max, notre chien, nous a accompagnés. Nous sommes partis tôt le matin, alors que le soleil se levait.

Nous avons marché dans les bois pendant un moment, cherchant des signes de lapins. Max reniflait le sol et courait devant nous. Après un moment, il a commencé à aboyer et à creuser près d'un buisson. Mon père m'a dit de me préparer.

Soudain, un lapin a sauté du buisson et a couru rapidement. J'ai levé mon fusil, mais j'étais trop lent. Mon père a tiré et a attrapé le lapin. Nous avons félicité Max pour son bon travail.

Nous avons continué à marcher et à chercher d'autres lapins. Finalement, nous avons attrapé trois lapins. Nous sommes rentrés à la maison avec notre prise. Ma mère était contente et a préparé un délicieux ragoût de lapin pour le dîner.

Ce jour-là, j'ai appris beaucoup sur la chasse et sur l'importance de la patience et de l'observation. J'étais fier de moi et reconnaissant pour cette expérience avec mon père et Max.

#### Vocabulaire
- Chasser (to hunt)
- Lapins (rabbits)
- Proposer (to suggest)
- Fusils (rifles)
- Accompagner (to accompany)
- Tôt le matin (early morning)
- Soleil (sun)
- Se lever (to rise)
- Bois (woods)
- Signes (signs)
- Renifler (to sniff)
- Courir (to run)
- Devant (ahead)
- Aboyer (to bark)
- Creuser (to dig)
- Buisson (bush)
- Préparer (to prepare)
- Sauter (to jump)
- Rapidement (quickly)
- Trop lent (too slow)
- Tirer (to shoot)
- Attraper (to catch)
- Féliciter (to congratulate)
- Prise (catch)
- Ragoût (stew)
- Dîner (dinner)
- Patience (patience)
- Observation (observation)
- Reconnaissant/reconnaissante (grateful)

items.title: 08 - La Chasse aux Lapins

items.content:
Un jour, au début de l'été, mon père m'a dit que nous allions récolter nos premiers légumes de la saison. J'étais très excité, car j'avais aidé à planter et à arroser les légumes pendant des mois. C'était enfin le moment de voir le fruit de notre travail.

Nous avons pris des paniers et sommes allés dans le jardin. Les plantes étaient hautes et vertes, et les légumes étaient mûrs et prêts à être cueillis. J'ai commencé par les tomates. Elles étaient rouges et juteuses. Mon père a cueilli des carottes, et ma mère a ramassé des haricots verts.

Max, notre chien, nous suivait partout, reniflant les légumes avec curiosité. Il semblait aussi heureux que nous de voir toute cette nourriture fraîche. Nous avons rempli plusieurs paniers de légumes et les avons rapportés à la maison.

Ma mère a préparé un grand repas avec nos légumes frais. Nous avons mangé des tomates, des carottes et des haricots verts, tout juste cueillis du jardin. C'était délicieux et nous étions tous très fiers de notre travail.

Ce soir-là, nous avons remercié la terre pour sa générosité et avons célébré notre première récolte. C'était un moment spécial pour notre famille, et j'ai appris l'importance du travail acharné et de la patience.

#### Vocabulaire
- Récolte (harvest)
- Début de l'été (beginning of summer)
- Légumes (vegetables)
- Saison (season)
- Excité (excited)
- Planter (to plant)
- Arroser (to water)
- Fruit de notre travail (fruit of our labor)
- Paniers (baskets)
- Jardin (garden)
- Plantes (plants)
- Mûr/mûre (ripe)
- Cueillir (to pick)
- Tomates (tomatoes)
- Juteux/juteuse (juicy)
- Carottes (carrots)
- Haricots verts (green beans)
- Renifler (to sniff)
- Curiosité (curiosity)
- Nourriture fraîche (fresh food)
- Remplir (to fill)
- Ramener (to bring back)
- Préparer (to prepare)
- Repas (meal)
- Générosité (generosity)
- Célébrer (to celebrate)
- Travail acharné (hard work)
- Patience (patience)

items.title: 07 -  La Première Récolte

items.content:
Un jour, en plein hiver, mon père a décidé de nous emmener en voyage en raquettes. La neige était épaisse et blanche, recouvrant tout le paysage. J'étais très excité car je n'avais jamais fait de raquettes auparavant.

Nous avons enfilé nos raquettes et avons commencé à marcher dans la forêt. Max, notre chien fidèle, nous suivait joyeusement, laissant de petites empreintes dans la neige. La forêt était calme et magnifique, avec les arbres couverts de neige scintillante.

Après une longue marche, nous sommes arrivés près d'un lac gelé. Mon père a dit que nous pouvions y faire un feu pour nous réchauffer et préparer un petit repas. Nous avons ramassé du bois et avons allumé un feu. Ma mère a sorti du pain et du fromage de son sac, et nous avons partagé un repas simple mais délicieux.

En rentrant à la maison, nous avons tous senti la chaleur de la famille et de l'aventure. Ce voyage en raquettes restera l'un de mes meilleurs souvenirs d'hiver. J'étais reconnaissant pour ces moments passés ensemble, et Max semblait partager notre bonheur.

#### Vocabulaire
- Plein hiver (mid-winter)
- Raquettes (snowshoes)
- Neige (snow)
- Épais/épaisse (thick)
- Blanc/blanche (white)
- Paysage (landscape)
- Excité (excited)
- Enfiler (to put on)
- Marcher (to walk)
- Forêt (forest)
- Fidèle (faithful)
- Empreintes (footprints)
- Calme (calm)
- Magnifique (beautiful)
- Arbres (trees)
- Scintillant (sparkling)
- Lac gelé (frozen lake)
- Feu (fire)
- Réchauffer (to warm up)
- Préparer (to prepare)
- Ramasser (to gather)
- Allumer (to light)
- Pain (bread)
- Fromage (cheese)
- Sac (bag)
- Partager (to share)
- Simple (simple)
- Délicieux/délicieuse (delicious)
- Rentrer (to return)
- Chaleur (warmth)
- Famille (family)
- Aventure (adventure)
- Souvenirs (memories)
- Reconnaissant/reconnaissante (grateful)
- Bonheur (happiness)

items.title: 06 - Le Voyage en Raquettes

items.content:
Un soir, alors que nous étions tous à la maison, Max, notre chien, a commencé à aboyer furieusement. Ce n'était pas son habitude d'aboyer sans raison, alors nous avons su que quelque chose n'allait pas.

Je suis sorti avec mon père pour voir ce qui se passait. Max courait vers l'étable en aboyant de plus en plus fort. Nous l'avons suivi rapidement. En arrivant près de l'étable, nous avons vu une ombre se déplacer près des chevaux.

Mon père a pris une lampe et nous avons éclairé l'étable. Nous avons découvert un homme qui essayait de voler notre meilleur cheval. Surpris par la lumière et les aboiements de Max, l'homme a pris peur et a couru. Mon père a crié après lui, mais l'homme a disparu dans la nuit.

Nous avons remercié Max pour sa vigilance. Grâce à lui, nous avons pu protéger nos chevaux et notre ferme. Max est vraiment un chien courageux et fidèle. Ce soir-là, nous lui avons donné un bon repas et beaucoup de câlins. Nous savions que nous pouvions toujours compter sur lui pour veiller sur nous et notre ferme.

### Une Rencontre avec les Indigènes
- Champs (fields)
- Indigènes (natives/indigenous people)
- Ferme (farm)
- Nerveux (nervous)

items.title: 04 - Max, le Héros de la Ferme

items.content:
Un jour, alors que je travaillais dans les champs, j'ai entendu un petit bruit derrière moi. Je me suis retourné et j'ai vu un petit chiot errant. Il était sale et semblait affamé. Mon cœur s'est serré pour lui.

Je l'ai pris dans mes bras et je l'ai ramené à la maison. Ma mère et mon père ont vu le chiot et ont tout de suite accepté de le garder. Nous l'avons nettoyé et lui avons donné à manger. Il était très content et a commencé à remuer la queue.

Nous avons décidé de l'appeler Max. Max est devenu un membre de notre famille. Il nous suivait partout, dans les champs et même à la maison. Il aimait jouer avec nous et nous faisait toujours rire avec ses petites bêtises.

Max nous a apporté beaucoup de joie. Même quand les jours étaient difficiles, il était toujours là pour nous réconforter. Nous étions heureux de lui offrir une nouvelle maison. Max a trouvé une famille, et nous avons trouvé un ami fidèle.

#### Vocabulaire

- Travailler (to work)
- Champs (fields)
- Bruit (noise)
- Derrière (behind)
- Chiot (puppy)
- Errant (stray)
- Sale (dirty)
- Affamé (hungry)
- Cœur (heart)
- Bras (arms)
- Ramené (brought back)
- Maison (house/home)
- Mère (mother)
- Père (father)
- Garder (to keep)
- Nettoyé (cleaned)
- Donner à manger (to feed)
- Content (happy)
- Remuer la queue (to wag the tail)
- Appeler (to name)
- Partout (everywhere)
- Jouer (to play)
- Rire (to laugh)
- Bêtises (mischief)
- Joie (joy)
- Difficile (difficult)
- Réconforter (to comfort)
- Nouvelle maison (new home)
- Famille (family)
- Ami fidèle (faithful friend)

items.title: 03 - Le Petit Chiot Errant

items.content:
Je m'appelle Louis. Un jour, quelque chose de dangereux est arrivé à la ferme. J'étais dans le champ avec mon père. Nous travaillions dur quand soudain, un taureau s'est échappé de l'enclos. Le taureau était grand et fort, et il avait l'air très en colère.

J'avais peur, mais je savais que je devais aider mon père. Le taureau courait partout, détruisant tout sur son passage. Mon père a essayé de l'arrêter, mais le taureau était trop rapide.

J'ai eu une idée. Je suis allé chercher une grande corde. Avec l'aide de mon père, nous avons réussi à attraper le taureau. Nous avons attaché la corde autour de son cou et, lentement, nous l'avons ramené à l'enclos.

C'était très difficile, mais nous avons réussi. Le taureau était de retour en sécurité, et mon père m'a félicité. J'étais fier de moi, même si j'étais encore un peu effrayé. Depuis ce jour, je fais très attention quand je suis près des taureaux. C'était une leçon importante pour moi à la ferme.

#### Vocabulaire

- Dangereux (dangerous)
- Ferme (farm)
- Champ (field)
- Travailler dur (to work hard)
- Taureau (bull)
- Échappé (escaped)
- Enclos (pen)
- Grand (big)
- Fort (strong)
- En colère (angry)
- Peur (fear)
- Aider (to help)
- Courir (to run)
- Détruire (to destroy)
- Passage (path)
- Arrêter (to stop)
- Rapide (fast)
- Idée (idea)
- Corde (rope)
- Réussi (succeeded)
- Attacher (to tie)
- Cou (neck)
- Lentement (slowly)
- Sécurité (safety)
- Félicité (congratulated)
- Fier/fière (proud)
- Effrayé (scared)
- Attention (careful)
- Leçon (lesson)

items.title: 02 - L'Évasion du Taureau

items.content:
Je m'appelle Louis. Je suis un garçon de ferme et j'ai immigré au Canada avec ma famille dans les années 1800. Nous vivons maintenant à Plantagenet, en Ontario. La vie ici est difficile, mais je travaille dur chaque jour.

Je me réveille très tôt le matin pour traire les vaches et nourrir les poules. Mon père travaille dans les champs, et je l'aide souvent. Ma mère prépare les repas et s'occupe de la maison. Nous devons tous travailler ensemble pour réussir.

J'aime la beauté de la nature canadienne. Les forêts sont grandes et les rivières sont claires. Parfois, après le travail, je marche dans les bois et je rêve d'avoir ma propre ferme un jour.

Même si la vie est difficile, je suis heureux ici. J'aime ma famille et j'aime notre nouvelle maison au Canada. Chaque jour, nous travaillons dur pour construire une meilleure vie. Je suis fier de ce que nous avons accompli et je suis plein d'espoir pour l'avenir.

#### Vocabulaire
- Garçon de ferme (farm boy)
- Immigré (immigrated)
- Canada
- Famille (family)
- Années 1800 (1800s)
- Ontario
- Difficile (difficult)
- Travailler dur (work hard)
- Réveiller (to wake up)
- Tôt (early)
- Traire les vaches (to milk the cows)
- Nourrir les poules (to feed the chickens)
- Champs (fields)
- Préparer les repas (to prepare meals)
- Maison (house/home)
- Ensemble (together)
- Réussir (to succeed)
- Beauté (beauty)
- Nature (nature)
- Forêts (forests)
- Rivières (rivers)
- Claires (clear)
- Bois (woods)
- Rêver (to dream)
- Ferme (farm)
- Heureux (happy)
- Nouvelle maison (new home)
- Construire (to build)
- Meilleure vie (better life)
- Fier/fière (proud)
- Accompli (accomplished)
- Plein d'espoir (hopeful)
- Avenir (future)

J'aime la beauté de la nature canadienne.
Les forêts sont grandes et les rivières sont claires.
Les forêts sont grandes et les rivières sont claires.
Parfois, après le travail, je marche dans les bois et je rêve d'avoir ma propre ferme un jour.

Je suis fier de ce que nous avons accompli et je suis plein d'espoir pour l'avenir.

items.content:
Es war ein heißer Sommertag, und Mia und Tom wollten sich abkühlen. Sie gingen zum See in der Nähe ihres Hauses. Der See war klar und kühl. Mia sprang als Erste ins Wasser und spritzte Tom nass.

Tom lachte und sprang hinterher. Sie schwammen, tauchten und spielten Fang im Wasser. Das Wasser war erfrischend und sie hatten viel Spaß. Sie bauten auch eine kleine Sandburg am Ufer und dekorierten sie mit Steinen und Muscheln.

Am Ende des Tages waren Mia und Tom müde, aber glücklich. Sie trockneten sich ab und gingen nach Hause. Es war ein perfekter Tag am See gewesen, und sie freuten sich schon auf das nächste Mal.

- trockneten (dried)
- nach Hause (home)

items.title: Spiel im Wasser an einem heißen Tag

items.content:
Anna und Ben gingen an einem sonnigen Samstag in den Zoo. Sie waren sehr aufgeregt, denn sie wollten die Tiere sehen. Zuerst gingen sie zu den Löwen. Die Löwen lagen faul in der Sonne und brüllten manchmal.

Dann besuchten sie das Affenhaus. Die Affen sprangen von Baum zu Baum und machten lustige Geräusche. Anna und Ben lachten und klatschten in die Hände. Es war sehr lustig, die Affen zu beobachten.

Zum Schluss gingen sie zum Elefantengehege. Die Elefanten waren riesig und spritzten Wasser mit ihren Rüsseln. Anna und Ben hatten viel Spaß und machten viele Fotos. Am Ende des Tages waren sie müde, aber glücklich über ihren tollen Tag im Zoo.

### Vocabulary

- Zoo (Zoo)
- sonnig (sunny)
- Samstag (Saturday)
- Tiere (animals)
- Löwen (lions)
- Sonne (sun)
- brüllten (roaring)
- Affenhaus (monkey house)

- Wasser (water)
- Rüssel (trunks)
- Spaß (fun)
- Fotos (photos)
- müde (tired)
- glücklich (happy)

items.title: Ein Ausflug in den Zoo

items.content:
Lea fand ein Buch im Park. Es war alt und hatte einen ledernen Einband. Neugierig öffnete sie es und sah viele bunte Bilder. Jedes Bild zeigte ein anderes Abenteuer. Lea las und las, die Geschichten zogen sie in ihren Bann.

Plötzlich begann das Buch zu leuchten. Lea fühlte sich leicht und wurde in die Welt der Geschichten gesogen. Sie landete in einem magischen Wald. Bäume flüsterten ihr Geheimnisse zu und Tiere sprachen mit ihr. Lea erlebte viele spannende Abenteuer, die sie nie vergessen würde.

Am Ende des Tages fühlte sich Lea glücklich und müde. Das Buch brachte sie zurück in den Park. Lea schloss es und versprach, wiederzukommen. Das Buch war nun ihr geheimes Tor zu einer Welt voller Magie.

### Vocabulary

- Buch (Book)
- Park (Park)
- alt (old)
- lederner Einband (leather-bound)
- neugierig (curious)
- Bilder (pictures)
- Abenteuer (adventures)
- leuchten (glow)
- Welt (world)
- magisch (magical)
- Wald (forest)
- Bäume (trees)
- Geheimnisse (secrets)
- Tiere (animals)
- spannend (exciting)
- glücklich (happy)
- müde (tired)
- versprochen (promised)
- zurückkommen (to return)
- Tor (gate)
- Magie (magic)

items.title: Das geheime Buch

items.content:
Today, I went to pick blueberries with my family. The sun was bright, and the sky was clear. We walked to the field where the blueberries grew. The bushes were full of big, juicy berries.

I took my basket and started picking the ripest blueberries I could find. Each one was a deep blue and tasted sweet. My fingers turned purple from the juice. I picked and picked until my basket was full.

After we finished, we sat under a big tree and shared the berries we picked. It was a fun day, and I was happy to spend it with my family. We laughed and talked as we enjoyed our tasty blueberries.

### Vocabulary List (สำหรับผู้เรียนภาษาอังกฤษชาวไทย)

items.content:
I found a special acorn today. It was the biggest and shiniest acorn I had ever seen. I picked it up and felt its smooth, cool surface. I knew I had to show it to my friends.

I ran to the meadow where my friends always play. "Look what I found!" I shouted. They all gathered around and admired the acorn. We decided to plant it and see if it would grow into a big tree.

We dug a small hole and placed the acorn inside. Every day, we watered it and made sure it had enough sunlight. As days passed, we saw a tiny sprout. We were so happy and excited to watch it grow.

items.title: The Special Acorn

items.content:
A squirrel named Sam lived in a big tree. Each day, Sam would gather nuts and store them in his home. He liked to jump from branch to branch and explore the forest.

One day, Sam found a shiny acorn. It was the biggest acorn he had ever seen! Sam wanted to show his friend, Jill. He ran as fast as he could to her tree. Jill was very impressed and they decided to share the acorn.

That night, Sam and Jill ate the acorn together. They laughed and told stories until the stars came out. It was a happy day for the busy squirrel and his friend.

items.title: The Busy Squirrel

items.content:
The rain fell all day long. It made the ground wet and muddy. The kids could not play outside. They had to stay inside the house.

Tom and Sue sat by the window. They watched the rain drops fall. Tom said, "Let's make a fort!" They used blankets and chairs to build a cozy fort. They laughed and played with their toys inside the fort.

As the rain kept falling, Mom made hot cocoa. She brought it to the fort. Tom and Sue drank the cocoa and felt warm. They listened to the rain and enjoyed their day indoors.

items.title: The Rainy Day

items.content:
One sunny day, Max and Lily went to the park. They played with their ball and had fun. Suddenly, they heard a soft bark. It was a small, lost puppy.

Max and Lily looked around, but no one was near. They decided to help the puppy. They gave it some water and a piece of their sandwich. The puppy wagged its tail happily.

After playing with the puppy for a while, they saw a lady running towards them. She was the puppy's owner. She thanked Max and Lily for finding her puppy. Max and Lily felt proud and happy as they waved goodbye to the puppy and its owner.

- happy - มีความสุข

items.title: The Lost Puppy

items.content:
Heute habe ich einen neuen Basketball bekommen. Ich konnte es kaum erwarten, ihn auszuprobieren. Also zog ich meine Sportschuhe an und ging zum Basketballplatz in der Nähe. Die Sonne schien, und es war ein perfekter Tag zum Spielen.

Auf dem Platz war niemand, also hatte ich ihn ganz für mich alleine. Ich dribbelte den Ball und machte ein paar Körbe. Der neue Basketball fühlte sich gut in meinen Händen an. Ich übte meine Würfe und versuchte, immer besser zu werden.

Nach einer Weile kamen ein paar Kinder aus der Nachbarschaft. Wir spielten zusammen ein Spiel und hatten viel Spaß. Mein neuer Basketball war perfekt, und ich freute mich, ihn mit meinen Freunden zu teilen. Es war ein toller Tag auf dem Basketballplatz.

### Vokabelliste

- neuer Basketball - New basketball
- ausprobieren - Try out
- Sportschuhe - Sports shoes
- Basketballplatz - Basketball court
- Sonne - Sun
- spielen - Play
- dribbeln - Dribble
- Körbe machen - Make baskets
- Hände - Hands
- Würfe - Shots
- besser werden - Get better
- Nachbarschaft - Neighborhood
- Kinder - Children
- zusammen - Together
- Spiel - Game
- Spaß haben - Have fun
- teilen - Share
- toller Tag - Great day

items.title: Mein neuer Basketball

items.content:
Heute habe ich mit meiner Oma Kekse gebacken. Ich liebe es, Zeit mit ihr in der Küche zu verbringen. Zuerst haben wir alle Zutaten auf den Tisch gelegt: Mehl, Zucker, Butter, Eier und Schokolade.

Oma hat mir gezeigt, wie man den Teig macht. Wir haben das Mehl und den Zucker in eine Schüssel gegeben. Dann haben wir die Butter und die Eier hinzugefügt und alles gut verrührt. Zum Schluss haben wir die Schokolade in kleine Stücke gebrochen und in den Teig gemischt.

Nachdem der Teig fertig war, haben wir kleine Kugeln daraus geformt und auf ein Blech gelegt. Oma hat das Blech in den Ofen geschoben. Der Duft der Kekse erfüllte bald die ganze Küche. Als die Kekse fertig waren, haben wir sie aus dem Ofen geholt und abkühlen lassen. Sie schmeckten wunderbar! Es war ein toller Tag, und ich freue mich schon auf das nächste Mal, wenn wir wieder zusammen backen.

### Vokabelliste

- Kekse - Cookies
- backen - Bake
- Oma - Grandmother
- Küche - Kitchen
- Zutaten - Ingredients
- Mehl - Flour
- Zucker - Sugar
- Butter - Butter
- Eier - Eggs
- Schokolade - Chocolate
- Teig - Dough
- Schüssel - Bowl
- rühren - Mix
- Stücke - Pieces
- Kugeln - Balls
- Blech - Baking tray
- Ofen - Oven
- Duft - Aroma
- abkühlen lassen - Let cool
- wunderbar - Wonderful
- nächstes Mal - Next time

items.title: Kekse backen mit Oma

items.content:
Heute habe ich den Nachmittag bei meiner Oma verbracht. Als ich ankam, wartete sie schon mit einer warmen Umarmung auf mich. Ihr Haus roch immer nach frisch gebackenen Keksen und Blumen aus ihrem Garten.

Oma hatte eine Überraschung für mich. Sie holte eine alte Kiste mit Fotos aus dem Schrank. Gemeinsam setzten wir uns auf das Sofa und schauten uns die Bilder an. Oma erzählte mir Geschichten über ihre Kindheit und unsere Familie. Es war spannend zu hören, wie das Leben früher war.

Nach dem Erzählen gingen wir in den Garten. Oma zeigte mir, wie man Blumen pflanzt und pflegt. Ich durfte ein paar Samen aussäen und war gespannt, wie sie wachsen würden. Der Nachmittag bei Oma war voller Liebe und Lachen. Ich freute mich schon auf den nächsten Besuch.

### Vokabelliste

items.title: Ein Nachmittag bei Oma

items.content:
Liam loved to look at the stars. Every night, he would sit by his window and watch them twinkle in the sky. One night, he saw a shooting star. He remembered his mom saying that if you make a wish on a shooting star, it might come true.

Liam closed his eyes and made a wish. He wished for a puppy to play with. The next morning, he woke up feeling hopeful. As he went downstairs, he heard a little bark. There, in the living room, was a tiny puppy with a big bow around its neck!

Liam was overjoyed. He hugged the puppy and named it Sparky. They became best friends, playing together every day. Liam knew that the wishing star had made his dream come true. He felt grateful and always looked at the stars with a smile.

### Vocabulary List

- Night (กลางคืน)
- Window (หน้าต่าง)

- Dream (ความฝัน)
- True (เป็นจริง)
- Grateful (ขอบคุณ)
- Smile (ยิ้ม)

items.title: The Wishing Star

items.content:
Sophie loved visiting her grandmother's house. One day, she noticed a beautiful vase on the shelf. It was covered in colorful flowers and sparkled in the sunlight. Her grandmother saw Sophie looking at the vase and smiled.

"That vase is special," her grandmother said. "It's a magic vase. When you make a wish and place a flower in it, the wish might come true." Sophie was excited. She ran to the garden, picked a lovely red flower, and gently placed it in the vase.

Sophie closed her eyes and made a wish. She wished for a sunny day to play outside with her friends. The next morning, she woke up to bright sunshine and clear skies. Sophie's wish had come true! She spent the day playing and laughing with her friends, knowing the magic vase had made it possible.

### Vocabulary List

- Visiting (เยี่ยมเยือน)

items.title: The Magic Vase

items.content:
Lucy had a kitten named Mittens. Mittens was very playful and loved to explore. One day, while Lucy was doing her homework, Mittens got into mischief. She climbed up the curtains and knocked over a vase.

Lucy heard the crash and ran to the living room. She found Mittens sitting on the floor, surrounded by pieces of the broken vase. Lucy sighed but couldn't help smiling at the naughty kitten. She carefully picked up the pieces and put them in the trash.

Later, Mittens tried to chase a butterfly in the garden. She jumped and pounced, but the butterfly always flew away just in time. Lucy watched and laughed, enjoying Mittens' playful antics. Even though Mittens could be naughty, Lucy loved her kitten very much.

### Vocabulary List

- Kitten (ลูกแมว)
- Playful (ขี้เล่น)

items.title: The Naughty Kitten

items.content:
Heute hat meine Oma frisches Brot gebacken. Der Duft des warmen Brotes erfüllte das ganze Haus. Ich konnte es kaum erwarten, ein Stück zu probieren. Oma nahm das Brot aus dem Ofen und legte es auf den Tisch, um es abkühlen zu lassen.

Nachdem es etwas abgekühlt war, schnitt sie eine dicke Scheibe ab und bestrich sie mit Butter. Ich nahm einen Bissen und das Brot schmeckte herrlich. Die Kruste war knusprig und das Innere weich und saftig. Oma lächelte, als sie sah, wie sehr ich das Brot genoss.

Wir setzten uns zusammen an den Tisch und aßen das frische Brot mit Marmelade und Honig. Es war ein einfaches, aber wunderbares Essen. Die fröhliche Atmosphäre und der köstliche Geschmack des Brotes machten diesen Moment besonders.

### Vokabelliste

- lächeln - Smile

- Marmelade - Jam
- Honig - Honey
- einfaches Essen - Simple meal
- fröhliche Atmosphäre - Cheerful atmosphere
- köstlicher Geschmack - Delicious taste
- Moment - Moment

items.title: Frisch gebackenes Brot

items.content:
Heute ging ich zum Teich, um die Enten zu füttern. Eine kleine Ente, die ich Emil nannte, kam sofort zu mir geschwommen. Emil war sehr neugierig und watschelte direkt zu meinen Füßen. Ich warf ihm ein paar Brotkrumen hin, die er schnell aufpickte.

Emil hatte glänzendes, gelbes Gefieder und einen lustigen, orangen Schnabel. Er schien immer hungrig zu sein, denn er schnatterte fröhlich, während er das Brot fraß. Andere Enten kamen auch, aber Emil blieb die ganze Zeit bei mir.

Nachdem er satt war, folgte Emil mir überall hin. Wir gingen am Teich entlang, und ich erzählte ihm Geschichten. Als es Zeit war zu gehen, winkte ich Emil zum Abschied. Ich freute mich schon darauf, ihn beim nächsten Besuch wiederzusehen.

items.title: Die kleine Ente

items.content:
Heute habe ich ein neues Fahrrad bekommen. Es ist blau und hat einen glänzenden Rahmen. Ich war so aufgeregt, es auszuprobieren. Nachdem ich meinen Helm aufgesetzt hatte, fuhr ich zum nahegelegenen Park.

Im Park gab es viele Wege und Hügel. Ich fuhr schnell den ersten Hügel hinunter und spürte den Wind in meinen Haaren. Es fühlte sich fantastisch an! Danach fuhr ich gemächlich um den See und genoss die Aussicht. Die Enten schwammen ruhig im Wasser, und die Blumen am Ufer blühten bunt.

Ich entdeckte auch einen kleinen Waldweg und beschloss, ihn zu erkunden. Die Fahrt durch den Wald war abenteuerlich und spannend. Als die Sonne unterging, fuhr ich glücklich nach Hause. Mein neues Fahrrad war einfach perfekt, und ich freute mich schon auf viele weitere Fahrten.

items.title: Das neue Fahrrad

items.content:
Heute fahre ich mit meiner Familie zum Strand. Die Sonne scheint, und der Himmel ist blau. Wir breiten unsere Handtücher auf dem warmen Sand aus und springen sofort ins kühle Wasser. Es ist so erfrischend!

Nach dem Schwimmen bauen wir eine große Sandburg. Wir graben einen Graben und schmücken die Burg mit Muscheln. Mama liest ein Buch unter einem Sonnenschirm, während Papa ein Nickerchen macht. Ich sammle bunte Steine und Seesterne am Ufer.

Am Abend machen wir ein Picknick und genießen den Sonnenuntergang. Der Himmel färbt sich in wunderschönen Orangetönen. Es war ein perfekter Tag am Strand, und ich freue mich schon auf den nächsten Besuch.

items.title: Ein Tag am Strand

items.content:
Eines Tages beschlossen meine Familie und ich, in die Berge zu fahren. Wir packten unser Auto mit warmen Kleidern, Essen und unserer Kamera. Die Fahrt war lang, aber die Aussicht auf die schneebedeckten Gipfel war atemberaubend.

Als wir ankamen, fanden wir eine gemütliche Hütte im Wald. Der Schnee funkelte in der Sonne, und wir machten uns sofort auf, die Umgebung zu erkunden. Wir bauten einen Schneemann, hatten eine Schneeballschlacht und gingen dann auf eine Wanderung durch den tiefen Schnee. 

Am Abend saßen wir alle zusammen vor dem Kamin in der Hütte. Wir tranken heißen Kakao und erzählten Geschichten. Die Wärme des Feuers und die Nähe der Familie machten diesen Tag unvergesslich. Die Reise in die Berge war ein Abenteuer, das ich nie vergessen werde.

items.title: Eine Reise in die Berge

items.content:
Es war ein schöner Herbsttag, und ich beschloss, einen Spaziergang im Park zu machen. Die Blätter an den Bäumen waren in leuchtenden Rot-, Gelb- und Orangetönen gefärbt und raschelten bei jedem Schritt, den ich machte. Die Luft war kühl und frisch, perfekt für einen gemütlichen Spaziergang.

Im Park sah ich viele Kinder, die Drachen steigen ließen. Ihre bunten Drachen tanzten im Wind und flogen hoch in den blauen Himmel. Einige Familien hatten Picknickdecken ausgebreitet und genossen die letzten warmen Sonnenstrahlen. 

Ich setzte mich auf eine Bank und schaute zu, wie die Eichhörnchen eifrig Nüsse sammelten. Ein kleiner Hund rannte fröhlich hinter einem Ball her, und ich konnte das fröhliche Lachen seiner Besitzer hören. Es war ein friedlicher und glücklicher Tag im Park, der mich daran erinnerte, wie schön der Herbst sein kann.

items.title: Ein Herbsttag im Park

items.content:
Heute habe ich meine neue Kamera bekommen. Ich war so aufgeregt, sie auszupacken und auszuprobieren. Die Kamera ist glänzend und schwarz, mit vielen Knöpfen und einem großen Bildschirm. Ich kann es kaum erwarten, Fotos zu machen.

Ich beschloss, in den Park zu gehen, um meine ersten Bilder zu machen. Die Sonne schien hell, und die Farben der Blumen und Bäume waren perfekt. Ich machte Fotos von allem, was mir gefiel: den bunten Blumen, den spielenden Kindern und den vorbeifliegenden Vögeln.

Nach einer Weile setzte ich mich auf eine Bank und schaute mir die Fotos an. Jedes Bild war klar und schön. Meine neue Kamera hat wirklich tolle Bilder gemacht. Ich wusste, dass ich noch viele wunderbare Momente mit dieser Kamera festhalten würde.

items.content:
Tommy was a cheerful little boy who loved to draw. Every day after school, he would rush to his room, grab his coloring book and pencils, and start creating wonderful pictures. His best friend, Max the golden retriever puppy, was always by his side, watching him with curious eyes.

One sunny afternoon, Tommy was drawing a picture of a brave knight. He imagined the knight going on exciting adventures, fighting dragons, and saving kingdoms. As he colored, he turned to Max and said, "Max, I wish we could go on an adventure like this knight."

To Tommy's surprise, Max barked and wagged his tail as if he understood. Suddenly, the room began to glow with a magical light. Tommy's drawing started to come to life! The knight jumped off the page, and the room transformed into a beautiful kingdom with tall castles and lush green fields.

"Wow, Max! We're in the kingdom from my drawing!" Tommy exclaimed. Max barked happily and led the way as they explored this magical land. They met friendly villagers, discovered hidden treasures, and even helped the knight defeat a dragon who had been eating the villagers' sheep.

Throughout their adventure, Tommy and Max learned about bravery, friendship, and the importance of helping others. As the sun began to set, the magical glow returned, and they found themselves back in Tommy's room.

"That was the best adventure ever, Max," Tommy said, hugging his puppy. Max licked Tommy's face, agreeing wholeheartedly. Tommy knew that with Max by his side, every day could be filled with magic and adventure.

### Questions

1. What is Tommy's favorite activity?
2. What did Tommy wish for while drawing?
3. What happened to Tommy's drawing of the knight?
4. What kind of adventure did Tommy and Max go on?
5. Who did Tommy and Max help during their adventure?

### Discussion Question

6. What kind of adventure would you like to go on if you had a magical drawing book?

items.content:
Es war ein sonniger Morgen. Max und seine Mutter waren am Bahnhof. Sie wollten den Zug nach Berlin nehmen, um Max' Großeltern zu besuchen. Max war sehr aufgeregt.

„Mama, ich kann es kaum erwarten, Oma und Opa zu sehen!“ sagte Max.

„Ich auch, Max,“ antwortete seine Mutter. „Aber zuerst müssen wir unsere Fahrkarten zeigen.“

Max suchte in seiner Tasche nach seinem Fahrschein. Doch er konnte ihn nicht finden.

„Mama, ich finde meinen Fahrschein nicht!“ sagte Max panisch.

„Schau noch einmal in deiner Tasche, Max,“ sagte seine Mutter ruhig.

Max durchsuchte seine Tasche wieder, aber der Fahrschein war nicht da. Seine Mutter half ihm, doch auch sie konnte den Fahrschein nicht finden.

„Vielleicht haben wir ihn im Laden verloren, als wir Wasser gekauft haben,“ sagte seine Mutter. „Wir müssen schnell zurückgehen und nachsehen.“

Max und seine Mutter liefen zurück zum Laden. Dort fragten sie den Verkäufer, ob er einen Fahrschein gefunden habe.

„Ja, ein kleiner Junge hat einen Fahrschein auf dem Boden gefunden und mir gegeben,“ sagte der Verkäufer. „Hier ist er.“

Max war so erleichtert. „Danke, danke!“ sagte er glücklich.

Sie eilten zurück zum Bahnhof. Der Zug stand schon bereit zur Abfahrt. Sie schafften es gerade noch rechtzeitig und stiegen ein.

„Das war knapp, Max,“ sagte seine Mutter. „Jetzt können wir unsere Reise genießen.“

„Ja, Mama,“ antwortete Max. „Ich werde meinen Fahrschein nie wieder verlieren.“

items.content:
Mala is from Thailand. She is an exchange student in America. She is in a small town. It is very different from Bangkok.

Mala's host family is the Millers. They are nice. They have two kids, Ethan and Lily. They eat meatloaf and mashed potatoes for dinner. Mala does not like it. She misses Thai food. She eats noodles in her room.

The next day is Mala's first day of school. The school is big. Mala is lost. She finds her English class. The teacher is nice. The other students say hello. Mala is shy.

Lunch is in the cafeteria. Mala eats pizza. She does not like it. She drinks chocolate milk. It is good. A girl named Sarah talks to Mala. They become friends.

Mala is tired at the end of the day. She is happy to have a new friend.
